result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court will allow the defendant to have release for work and school. Court will allow the defendant to receive good time.

miscConds.notes:
Court will defer ruling on restitution until a restitution hearing. Parties to advise the Court if a stipulation is reached. 
Restitution hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay DNA surcharge during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Per the Court, defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Be enrolled in school full time. If not in school full time, be employed for at least 30 hours per week.
No contact with the victim or her residence with the exception of incidental contact in school.
Expungement is authorized by the Court upon successful completion of probation.

Participate in at least one counseling session for a duration of no less than two hours on healthy sexual relationships and provide proof of attendance to agent.
Comply with all rules as set forth by agent.
Court ordered the defendant be supervised as a routine misdemeanant, not under the sex offender unit.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Wright

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant has filed a request for expungement of his misdemeanor conviction pursuant to s.s. 973.015(1), Stats., for "Special Disposition."
The request for expungement is denied.  The defendant did not successfully complete probation. - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to the parties.

Dept. of Corrections filed Notice Of Failure To Meet Conditions For Expungement.  Defendant was not going to school full-time or employed at least 30 hours per week during his probation supervision.  Defendant did not bring in verification showing he participated in at least one counseling session.  All Court ordered financial obligations, as conditions of probation, have not been paid in full.

Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. spc
Notice of Failure to Meet Condition for Expungement.  Received and filed.
Documents to be attached to motion for expungement filed by Attorney Jason Baltz.
Letter to Atty. Jason Baltz.
Defendant's motion for expungement.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for adjourned restitution hearing. Defendant's appearance for today's date was previously waived by the Court. State advised the Court he is not requesting restitution in this matter for reasons stated on the record. Discussion regarding victim notification in this matter. Court ordered this matter passed for the State to confer with the victim witness advocate. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Defense counsel requested restitution be set at zero. Court granted defense request and ordered restitution be set at ZERO. Court took no further action.
Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for restitution hearing. Court previously WAIVED the defendant's appearance for this hearing. The State is still gathering documentation from the Crime Victim Compensation Program and requests an adjourned restitution hearing date. Defense counsel does not object. Court granted the State's request for adjournment. Court will retain this matter post rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Victim Impact Statement with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State placed negotiations on the record. Defendant sworn in.   
As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. For reasons stated on the record, Court granted the defense request for an adjournment of sentencing. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defense counsel received and filed.

Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Michael Thurston appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter and reqeust a projected plea date. Parties to advise the Court if they wish to proceed to sentencing on the same date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Attorney Baltz has recently been appointed in this matter and requests additional time to review the case with the defendant. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail refund check packet.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-26-2015

Defendant Tyler J Wright in court PRO SE.  Kevin Shomin appeared for Michael Thurston for the State of Wisconsin. Court copy of Criminal Complaint not in the file. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant in process of retaining private counsel. Court adjourned case to allow defendant time to retain counsel. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.M.T. dob 11-4-1999.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyler J Wright in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THEY HIRED ATTORNEY MICHAEL HAYES BUT HE COULD NOT BE IN COURT THIS AFTERNOON.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 25.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case was not scheduled until 03-27-2015 at 01:30 pm. for an Initial Appearance in CCCR.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Tyler J Wright not in court.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an arrest  warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 
*** Court makes findings that there is no possible victim identified therefore recompense is an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/26/15 @ 1:30pm
